question: I am a lawfully present immigrant who is not eligible yet to receive Medical Assistance. Is there a way I can enroll in Virginia's Insurance Marketplace during the Special Enrollment Period?
text:
I am a lawfully present immigrant who is not eligible yet to receive Medical Assistance. Is there a way I can enroll in Virginia's Insurance Marketplace during the Special Enrollment Period?
          
        
Yes! Virginia's Insurance Marketplace has added a new Qualifying Life Event (QLE) for those who have an annual income equal to or below the 150% Federal Poverty Level (FPL). Below is a table that shows the income amount.
"Household / Family Size","Income 150% FPL"
"Single","$19 320"
"2-person","$26 130"
"3-person","$32 940"
"4-person","$39 750"
"6-person","$53 370"
"8-person","$66 990"

For other family sizes, please
to this link
.
If you are a lawfully present immigrant and are not able to enroll through Medical Assistance yet, you may qualify to enroll in coverage through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace and enroll under this qualifying life event. To do so, follow these steps below:

Go to Virginia's Insurance Marketplace, click
Get Covered,
and submit a new Virginia's Insurance Marketplace application.

If you qualify, a Special Enrollment Period (SEP) will automatically open!

Once the SEP opens, you will have 60-days to enroll in a plan through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace. Once you enroll, coverage will begin the start of the following month.
